WRITING.TEXT: When you say you relapsed, what did you relapse from? I guess I'm wondering if you mean that by relapsing you've gained more weight or if by relapsing you've started fasting again? Just wanna see if I can help or be there for you #10084;
Are you close enough with your mom to talk to her about needing more help?
I know, and I guess I'm just more scared of gaining weight. Thank you!
Even if you talked to her?

WRITING.TITLE: Am I the only one?
WRITING.TEXT: I feel like a horrible person, but when other people lose weight like my friends, I get almost angry that they are losing weight. It's awful for me to think this way, but I cant help it. I have this weird need to be the only person losing weight, cause if someone else is losing weight then I feel like I'm a failure and they are better than me. I am happy for others to a point, but mainly I just get so angry at them and myself. I've never EVER shown my feelings and never would. I feel like apart of it is that I'm jealous, even when I've lost more or continue losing more. Does anyone else struggle with this or am I just a horrible person? I hate it so much, and it doesn't make sense to me.

No one really knows about my ED. My boyfriend knows, but he doesn't understand and it's hard to talk to him about it. Same goes for my friends. But that's very reassuring! I swear I was just a horrible person

I agree, but it's like no one else can see it and I'm left suffering. Like my bf being on social media stresses me out just because of how unpredictable people can be. Like his ex messaged him all the time on snapchat and its things like that that make me not want it anymore
I agree, it's just not worth it
I have one if you're interested still?

Thank you, and I didnt mean to make it sound like I was wanting someone to diagnose me, more give some insight into my wacked out habits. I never look at an ED as something as simple as a relationship with food. More that if I'm not skinny and eat constantly theres no way I'm valid. So thank you very much #128522;
Thank you #128522; I guess I just have the warped view that if you eat too much its not a real disorder which I know is wrong
It really sucks. I struggle with feeling valid in the sense that I'm so back and forth and especially since I haven't been medically diagnosed.

I feel you. I come from a long line of German/Russian blood and so my metabolism was shot from conception. I can't even look at food without gaining weight, which sucks especially when all my friends could eat everything and be naturally skinny. Genetics can suck my dick honestly. But I get where you're coming from. Enjoy your metabolism for now though!

The age old question. Personally, all calories I have up until I sleep is for the day. So I would count those calories for the day you were awake before you went to sleep, then start the new day when you wake up. That's just what I do though, I think it comes down to you!

I am the exact same way. It makes everything so difficult because food is on my mind 24/7. Its always going back and forth between wanting food and telling myself no. I'm actually exhausted everyday from the internal battle I have. I would give ANYTHING to have no taste buds or to hate food or something like that. It sucks.
I know where you're coming from. Its all I think about, like I can't do anything without that overpowering my thoughts. I need to be hypnotized or something.
This quarantine is not good for anyone, especially those suffering mentally. I'm right there with you.

WRITING.TITLE: I need friends
WRITING.TEXT: You know those people who are like "lol I have zero friends" but are always out hanging with people and having a good time? I'm serious when I say I have no friends. It sucks because I have a boyfriend and wish I could be with him all the time, but he has friends he hangs out with and I'm basically left alone waiting for him. Part of me is grateful so I don't have to worry about more people knowing about my eating habits and self-harm, but it gets old being alone all the time. Just wish I could find people like me to hang out with. Anyone else relate? *EDIT: if anyone wants to just text or have someone to talk to, let me know. Obviously I could use the friendship as well.

Woah. This is what started it for me. I didn't even realize it till now. My mind is blown. The weight obsession, the guilt of gaining, being fatter than my friends, the forced exercising, all at age 10 #128579;
Thank you #128522;
Perfect explanation.

I think it can be a personal distinction. My definition of a large meal could be someone else's over eating or binging. I think calorie wise, you can figure out what would be considered the difference, but I think it's beneficial to figure out what YOUR distinctions are.
I'm in ND and its the exact same. Its so cold and been snowing and I'm pissed.
Woah I read that thinking I was looking in a mirror. I'm here anytime you need to talk #128522;
Mood
Have you considered talking to a therapist? I see one every week and it helps to just have someone to talk to that you know won't judge and just want to help you.

If you do the exact same thing over time, your body can start to plateau. Switching up diet and exercise can help so your body doesn't get used to the same thing. There's alot of tips online about getting over a plateau, like earing more protein or exercising more.
This is me so bad right now. C's get degrees #129305; #127995;
Me tho

If your thought of killing become closer to something that might happen, you need to go to an emergency room and tell them you need to be placed in a psych watch. Then you should probably be able to get a therapist right away for how extreme your thoughts and hallucinations are.

This is me right now. I'm taking 5 classes and 4 of them were on campus because I hate online. I've always gotten low grades with them and it makes it harder for me to get assignments done. But now with this stupid pandemic, all my classes are online and I'm drowning. I'm not handing in assignments or doing anything near what I need to. So yea, I totally relate.
Which app is that?
I HATE tea and I HATE myself for hating it. What tea should I start with to get myself liking it?? I started with green tea and it was so horrible and sad cause I really wanted to like it #128557;
Is it like applesauce? I'm having a hard time understanding drinkable jelly
Thank you #128522;
Thanks!!!

I had a friend who treated me poorly too. Even though it hurts to go through that with someone, eventually you'll see that the pain of losing them is worth it compared to the pain caused by keeping the toxic person in your life. You'll be stronger and better off without them. I am here if you ever need a friend #10084;

The fact that she was abusive before becoming disabled shows that it doesn't matter she can't get around well anymore. Also, being disabled is NOT an excuse to treat anyone badly. I would stop giving in to her and focus on YOU. The way you've been treated, I would tell her, those family members, and friends who turn against you to screw off. Take care of yourself first and whoever has something negative to say about that is toxic and shouldn't be in your life. Keep looking for roommates and get the hell out. You deserve so much better.
This is exactly me right now. Its so horrible.
My exact thoughts. I want to look like I haven't slept or eaten for centuries. I want dark and sunken eyes, a bruised, pale body; and a faint blue tint to my skin as though I've been dead.
I can't even begin to share my apologies for you. I can't imagine the situation you're in, and I hope she is OK. I'm very sorry that you're going through this, and if you ever need to talk, I'm here.

I'm not sure about getting diagnosed when you can't leave, could you schedule a telehealth appointment with a doctor to possibly be diagnosed? Anyway you can reach out to a medical professional is going to go a long way. I'm very sorry you're struggling, this quarantine has been a big hit to the mental health community. I'm right where you are, you're not alone #10084;
This is genius.
This is a great description of what life has been like for me

I do this alot. Since I struggle with depression, ill go through those phases where I just don't care about anything and ill eat like normal or even more than normal. And then when my depression flips and turns to my anxiety, ill freak out that I haven't been starving or restricting and go back to not eating. And this vicious cycle will continue.
Same

Personally I agree, I think its best you move on. He isn't doing your mental health any good, and you deserve way better. I don't have any friends either, so I know the pain you're going through. But it is better to be alone than to be with or talk to someone who makes you feel lonely.

I understand, i was in the same situation too. Its so hard, but you're basically prolonging inevitable pain. And the longer you wait the more it will hurt. If you want to try to keep him in your life, maybe you should reach out and tell him everything you're feeling

I've tried edibles before because my friend who has bad anxiety told me it's the greatest thing for her. When I tried them tho, I got horribly paranoid. I wanted to rip my skin off and it was like my normal anxiety x100000. I know that its done miracles for people with anxiety, but in my personal experience it's been hell. So maybe try a little bit at a time? Just cause my experience was bad, doesn't mean yours will be. I hope if you do try it that you'll find the relief you're looking for #128522;
I brush my hair and wash my face to make sure and get all that extra weight off my body before weighing. You know the 6 strands of hair and thin layer of oil on my face really changes my weight
I'm the exact same way.

The key is to never have a class before noon. Thats how I got through. And by got through I mean never did my work, failed tests, and had zero motivation to succeed. The goal was to pass, so as long as I finished with a GPA of 2.0, I was good.
Agree to disagree
A few days ago, said negative but I #8217;m still nervous
What part did Nin have in everything? I thought they were completely in the dark about who TP was?

Thank you! I just want to know the facts of what #8217;s going on instead of taking sides with no information. I guess it #8217;s also hard for me to realize that Nin isn #8217;t who I thought she was. Which is why I want to know what is legit and be objective.

WRITING.TITLE: But Like Why Do I Eat
WRITING.TEXT: Why tho? I don #8217;t like eating, I don #8217;t like getting fat, I don #8217;t like feeling gross, I don #8217;t like looking disgusting, I don #8217;t like hating myself 24/7, yet I still eat. I eat when I #8217;m sad, tired, happy, in pain, hurt, everything. I can #8217;t stop thinking about food and the guilt of eating. Why can #8217;t I just stop?
Bless
Can I ask what the weight change was?
